reviews.text: I had high expectations of this hotel given the reviews I had read about it. I even paid a lot more to have a superior room. What I got was a family room with bunk beds (I was travelling on business so last thing I needed), it was meant to have a king bed but was just two single beds pushed together. No soap or shampoo but some horrible detergent stuck on the wall of the shower ... and the shower was in the bedroom (no door you shower a few feet from the bed). The room was decorated about as cheaply as you could get - curtains where just backing material with no proper drapes. The room was really noisy - went on until the early morning and the airconditioning didn't work.
reviews.title: What an awful hotel

reviews.text: The hotel staff where as bad as the room - tried to charge for internet and breakfast even though included in the rate but they refused to believe it until I created a fuss.
reviews.title: Great Location - rest average

reviews.text: An elegant art deco hotel in a relatively quiet street very close to the Ku'damm shopping street, the massive KaDeWe department store, the Europa Centre, the Zoo and a U-bahn subway station. Minimalist decor - basically all white with lots of great monochrome photographs of jazz performers - and some areas like the stairwells do betray its former use as government offices. Rooms do seem small for a 4 star hotel, but mine was perfectly comfortable and quiet. Service was friendly and efficient, and the buffet had a great selection of food.
reviews.title: Stylish rather than luxurious, good service and location

reviews.text: Apparently a former Eastern German state taxation office, now a vast hotel. If you only visited the bar and/or restaurant you'd assume the place was comparable to the best London 5 star hotels - very stylish and excellent personal service. Nice food too. Upstairs, the building's history is more apparent. Rooms are small and strangely designed as a result, to fit bathrooms in. The toilet is in its own room (cupboard) and the shower and basin are in the centre of the room with no privacy from any other occupants of the room, so if you are sharing, go with someone you know well. If this isn't an issue for you then it's well worth a stay, particularly at sub-100 euro prices.
reviews.title: Atmospheric hotel, top quality service

reviews.text: interesting and tasteful design in the public areas. poor-empty corridors and very small (standard) rooms with very small beds, no doulbes available on standard rooms. breakfast area uncomfortable (most seats at benches which is maybe nice if you want to socialize, but definetely very bad for the back). At 7,30am housekeeping knocks your door, so do not forget to hang the Do not disturb. Do not trust reception if you want to book a taxi, better do it yourself. The cigar lounge is also general smoking lounge, which kills the cigar experience.
reviews.title: expectation gap

reviews.text: This place is stylish, but the rooms are small although we had a so called superior room. The carpet was not the cleanest one, the walls in the room were calling for a fresh paint. Ask the reception for a written essay to the history of the building - is fun.
reviews.title: Nice location, but rooms need some 'refreshment'

reviews.text: Cons: Hotel rooms are small - like those typical in most European cities. Layout of room with shower in middle section of room is just odd and not well laid out. Predominate colors of this place is white and grey in lobby and common areas and in the rooms (at least my room) and I feel like i'm in a bath room. This place needs to add some warmth and color to everything!

reviews.text: If you are a business traveler, this hotel is NOT for you. There's no ironing board in room, desk is tiny, and worst of all there is not internet access in the rooms (at least not currently - they are supposedly upgrading facilities to have wi-fi in rooms at some point). There is wi-fi available in the public areas, BUT unbelievably they charge you for it! Rates are not cheap either - 3 euros/hr or 24 euros/24 hrs.
reviews.title: Small clean modern rooms central location great shopping.

reviews.text: The price quality parameter is in top for the Ellington Htl. We did book some month in advance, so we had an even more attractive price. The room we stayed in was large (deluxe) and moderne. The breakfast buffet (good selection) was not included in our rate, and this of course comes extra. It has a good location, in the shopping area of Berlin. Ellington is of course not a five star hotel, however the design and interior of the hotel is very attractive.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with good location

reviews.text: I will definitely return next time I am in Berlin.
